newsitem.title: GERMANY: Telekom seeks to raise 4.75-5.7 bln marks abroad.
newsitem.headline: Telekom seeks to raise 4.75-5.7 bln marks abroad.

text.p: Deutsche Telekom AG is seeking to raise between 4.75 and 5.7 billion marks ($3.7 billion) from foreign investors when its floats its shares worldwide next month, finance director Joachim Kroeske said on Monday.
Around two-thirds of the issue is to be placed in Germany, but the remaining 33-38 percent has been earmarked for foreign investors.
Kroeske told a news conference that, at an issue price of between 25 and 30 marks, Telekom had a book value of around 75 billion marks.
Telekom is issuing 500 million shares in the form of a capital increase, with a so-called "greenshoe" option to place a further 75 million shares.
"With that, based on the price range, there will be a total volume of the issue of up to 15 billion marks," Kroeske told reporters.
